title: Memory: Working and Long-Term
content: Working memory holds approximately 7 items briefly. Long-term memory stores vast information but retrieval is imperfect and influenced by context. Relying on memory for critical operational information is a design flawâ€”use checklists, references, and documentation.

scenario.story: An operator must remember a six-step procedure executed quarterly. They remember five steps, skip the third, and execute in wrong order. The procedure has existed for years but is only documented informally.

options.B: Infrequent, complex procedures require documented references, not memory

scenario.explanation: Memory degrades with time and infrequency. Complex procedures executed quarterly will have recall errors regardless of training. Documented checklists compensate for memory limitations and ensure consistent execution.
